intro: Gamochaeta monticola, commonly known as the mountain gamochaeta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white to pale purple. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid environment. Gamochaeta monticola is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to cool, sunny conditions.
